metadata.title: USN-5286-1 -- cryptsetup vulnerability
metadata.description: Milan Broz discovered that cryptsetup incorrectly handled LUKS2 reencryption recovery. An attacker with physical access to modify the encrypted device header may trigger the device to be unencrypted the next time it is mounted by the user.  On Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, this issue was fixed by disabling the online reencryption feature.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5286-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  cryptsetup - 2:2.2.2-3ubuntu2.4 cryptsetup-run - 2:2.2.2-3ubuntu2.4 libcryptsetup12 - 2:2.2.2-3ubuntu2.4 libcryptsetup-dev - 2:2.2.2-3ubuntu2.4 cryptsetup-bin - 2:2.2.2-3ubuntu2.4 cryptsetup-initramfs - 2:2.2.2-3ubuntu2.4 No subscription required
